laboratory_examinations.findings: WBC count: 12.2 x 10^3 cells/mm3 (high), Absolute neutrophil count: 10.7 x 10^3 cells/mm3 (high)
WBC count: 125 cells/mm3 (59% lymphocytes, 28% neutrophils, 13% monocytes), CSF protein: 65 mg/dL, CSF glucose: 91 mg/dL, 3 RBCs/mm3; Gram stain revealed no organisms.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CSF sample positive for orthopoxvirus IgM; negative for orthopoxvirus DNA on day 3.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for orthopoxvirus and other pathogens (mycobacterial, fungal cultures; VDRL for syphilis; arbovirus antibodies).

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Negative for HHV-7 by pan herpesvirus PCR on day 9.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Negative for flaviviruses, alphaviruses, bunyaviruses, adenoviruses, coronaviruses, polyomaviruses, bornaviruses, paramyxoviruses, and rhabdoviruses.
Day 1: multiple high-signal lesions; Day 8: progression of bilateral lesions; 4 months: nearly complete resolution of signal abnormalities.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression observed from Day 1 to Day 8, with improvement noted by 4 months.
